text: Nails is a 1979 Canadian short documentary film directed by Phillip Borsos.Far from Home: The Adventures of Yellow Dog + Nails|The Cinematheque It was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Documentary Short, and was named Best Theatrical Short in 1980 at the 1st Genie Awards.Maria Topalovich, And the Genie Goes To...: Celebrating 50 Years of the Canadian Film Awards. Stoddart Publishing, 2000. . pp. 129-133. ==Synopsis== A blacksmith is seen labouring at his forge, shaping nails from single strands of steel rods. The scene shifts from this peaceful setting to the roar of a 20th-century nail mill, where banks of machines draw, cut and pound the steel rods faster than the eye can follow. ==References== ==External links== * *Watch Nails at NFB.ca Category:1979 films Category:1979 documentary films Category:1979 short films Category:Canadian films Category:Canadian short documentary films Category:English-language films Category:Documentary films about technology Category:Films directed by Phillip Borsos Category:Films without speech Category:National Film Board of Canada documentaries Category:National Film Board of Canada short films Category:Best Theatrical Short Film Genie and Canadian Screen Award winners Category:Nail (fastener)
